name: Sokha Angkor Resort

reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay at Sokhar Angkor
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. The deluxe room we had was big, spacious and very well appointed. The toilet was clean, with good pressure for both warm and cold water. It had all the ammenities we would have expected from a five star hotel. We liked the comfortable padded slippers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service was great. Each time we returned from an outing, we find our bed tidied.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, quiet and spacious

likes.liked: — Beautiful pool, and had lovely massage in spa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was one of the best we have had. Wide choices and good bread selection, cheese, fruits and salads, western and local dishes.
reviews.title: Good choise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the salt water pool is excellent. It does not have the chlorine that makes your hair stiffs and your eyes red. And the pool is big too. We enjoyed the gym, sauna and steam room.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
Best hotel of the trip
reviews.text: The location is not too far from the popular Pub Street in the old town. You can take a tuk-tuk if you don't want to walk. The hotel is a short walking distance to the famous FCC. There are also many good authentic Khmer eating places if you really want to go for the real Khmer food the the locals go to.

Now this is the best hotel I ever stayed in for around $150/night. Yes, you get a King Bed. Yes, they have a Sushi Bar, Irish Pub, pool, gym, heavenly breakfast buffet. Yes, you get your welcome drink at arrival (they check you in at the desk, bring you a drink, and only then take you upstairs to the room). Room is big, flat screen TV, fruit basket is standard. Bathroom is sweet, has some luxury fetures (could have more, but good enough). Nice carpeting all around, marlbe floor lobby downstairs. Security guard at the courtyard entrance. Cell phones connections are a little iffy, go through Malasian Telecom, mostly half duplex ..... i.e. only 1 person talks the other listens ..... old E. F. Hutton joke tie in?
reviews.title: BEST KING BED $150 CAN BUY YOU

likes.disliked: — oops, my mind is running blank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now remember, this is a VERY poor country, with VERY poor people around. There isn't too much to do outside the hotel. People come for their Angkor Wat tours. Most people are picked up from the hotel by a tour guide in the morning, driven around the sights during the day, and brought back to the hotel around 4 PM. Life revolves around the hotel, the pool, and the escorted day tour. There is a folklore evening, outside the hotel, one can arrange to be escorted to.
reviews.title: faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now listen people. King bed rooms are available under $200 dollars. There is no point to buy luxury suites for $1000 when you going to get the same pool, restaurants, lobby, and Angkor Wat. Save your suite money for the Ritz in Paris.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Life never gets better for under $200/day.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: about ten mins walk from town centre.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thought this was a really sweet and nicely run hotel. I loved the noodles for breakfast - a great fill before temple walking. Plus enjoyed the pool afterwards..
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Sokha from 24-28 May 2008. It is a pretty new hotel and is very clean, spacious and big. Upon arrival at the airport, we were picked up by the hotel concierge and were immediately served cold towels and cold water in the car. Very refreshing. Check-in was done entirely by the hotel staff while we sat enjoying our welcome drinks. The room is very clean, big, spacious and nice, facing the pool. The King-size bed is firm and the pillows were very soft. I usually cannot sleep on the first night but this time, I could sleep soundly and comfortably till the next morning. The amenities in the room and bathroom were great.
reviews.title: Love it !! Very excellent Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is ok with quite a spread. I liked the soup noodles best. We had a complimentary massage in the hotel and it was excellent! As our flight was a late flight on the last day, the hotel extended our room till 3pm upon request without extra cost. Overall, it was a great stay at this hotel. The hotel is about 15-20mins walk to the pub street and the old market, easily accessible by tuk-tuk. There is also a Caltex minimart opposite across the hotel. A good location, quiet and exclusive, yet accessible to the temples and pub street. I would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to Siem Reap.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with fab swimming pool

likes.disliked: — Quite a long walk into town (especially after a long day walking around temples!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative point was the guide/driver that we engaged through the hotel at US$35 each. I guess it is not the hotel's fault but I think they should screen the guide and driver before recommending them to the hotel guests. The guide was not very professional and we felt cheated as the tours ended around 3pm and 1.30pm respectively on 2 full days tour. I thought I could at least use the car till 4-5pm but the driver left with the guide. He seems to be taking orders from the guide! Better get a tuk-tuk and go temple hopping on your own. I got a good and humble one from the hotel to see the sunset at Bakheng Hill as the guide was reluctant to go, giving excuses that it was cloudy. Well, even though it was cloudy, the view from the top of the hill was worth the trip. So remember to spell out the length of tour with the guide and driver before engaging them.
reviews.title: Can not fault this hotel

likes.liked: — Not one thing I didn't like

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and thought the hotel was exceptional. The room was huge along with the bathroom. It was also very clean, had character to it and had all the mod cons. Our room overlooked the enormous swimming pool so was very quiet (apart from the sound of the waterfall into the pool!).
reviews.title: would not recommend to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the excellent reviews I did have to check that it was the same hotel we stayed in on our last 2 nights in
reviews.title: Nothing Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Indio china.
reviews.title: Amazing, fantastic, couldn't be better!!!

reviews.text: Yes it was, and I can only say we found it to be very average.
reviews.title: Beautiful oasis of calm, plus great staff and delicious food

likes.liked: — lovely rooms, peaceful garden, impeccable staff
likes.disliked: — slightly kitsch from outside,crowded breakfast room

reviews.text: So many hotels are going up in this area and all look very much the same.
reviews.title: excellent family hotel!

reviews.text: We did think it was a little impersonal and the staff where not enthusiastic.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it but...

likes.liked: — 5-star style accommodations for a small price
likes.disliked: — service staff entering rooms without warning

description: Sokha Angkor offers luxurious resort living in central Siem Reap! Provide instant Temple Passes- Within walking distance to famous Pub Street and Night Market- 15 minutes drive to Airport- 10 minutes drive to Golf Course- 10 minutes drive to Angkor Balloon ( Tethered Balloon )- Located in the heart of Siem Reap- Large salt water swimming pool- Complimentary Unlimited Internet Access- Affiliated with over 500 hotels across the world
